intro: Retiniphyllum martianum, commonly known as the Martian starplant, is a unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves that resemble the patterns of the night sky. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle yet elegant appearance. Retiniphyllum martianum thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for drought-prone environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
